events: April 28 – Erik Magnusson is recognized as king of most of Sweden, in opposition to his father, King Magnus.[1]
May 28 – Peter I becomes King of Portugal, after the death of his father, Alfonso IV.[2]
July 9 – Charles Bridge in Prague is founded.[3]
King David II of Scotland is released by the English, in return for a ransom.[4]
Berdibek succeeds Jani Beg, as Khan of the Blue Horde.[5]

Battle of Bubat: The Sundanese royal family is massacred by the Majapahit Army on the orders of Gajah Mada; the death toll includes Sundanese King Lingga Buana and Princess Dyah Pitaloka Citraresmi, who commits suicide.
Rao Kanhadev becomes Rathore ruler of Marwar (now part of India).[6]
Influenza is first identified as a disease.[7]
The first public exhibition of the Shroud of Turin is recorded.[8]
The Blue Horde unseats Ghazan II as the ruler of the Il-Khanate, and appoints their own governor.
The Wat Phra Si Rattana Mahathat (Famous Wat Yai) Temple is constructed in Phitsanulok, Thailand.[9]
In France, the Estates General passes Étienne Marcel's Great Ordinance in an attempt to impose limits on the monarchy, in particular in fiscal and monetary matters.[10]
births: April 11 – King John I of Portugal (d. 1433)[11]
